events.title: Australia’s 2025 road toll: NSW records highest number of deaths in eight years as fatalities rise nationwide
events.description: Authorities warn that speeding was the biggest killer in 2025, a contributing factor in 134 deaths New South Wales has recorded the deadliest year on its roads in eight years, with indications that there was no progress in curbing road fatalities nationwide in 2025. In 2025, 355 people died on roads in NSW, 28 more than in 2024, the state government announced on Friday. It is the highest annual death toll on the state’s roads since 2017, when there were 392 deaths. Continue reading...

events.title: US military confirms 5 killed in Dec 31 kinetic strike on reported narco-terror vessels
events.description: A military operation targeted drug trafficking vessels on Dec. 31, resulting in five deaths during a kinetic strike against reported narco-terrorists.

events.title: Trump’s shadow war in Venezuela grows, but country’s strongman leader still clings to power
events.description: Report of a drone attack on a port facility signals new phase in US military campaign against Nicolás Maduro US wargames played out scenarios for Maduro’s fall. None of them ended well for Venezuela Nearly a week after Donald Trump first announced what he said was the first US ground strike in a four-month-long military pressure campaign against Venezuela , details remain very thin on the ground. CNN and the New York Times reported late on Monday that they had confirmed the CIA had used a drone to target a “port facility” allegedly used by the Tren de Aragua street gang. No casualties were reported, but the date, time and location of the attack remain unknown. Venezuela’s strongman leader, Nicolás Maduro , and his government have remained silent. If confirmed, the first strike on land would mark a new phase in a campaign that since August has involved the deployment of a massive US naval fleet, airstrikes that have so far killed 107 people, a “total blockade” of sanctioned oil tankers, the seizure of two vessels and the pursuit of a third. Continue reading...

events.title: US military destroys narco-terror convoy of three vessels at sea in kinetic strikes
events.description: U.S. military strikes reportedly kill three people in overnight operation against alleged narco-terrorist drug trafficking convoy in international waters.

events.title: Anthony Joshua’s camp confirm two of his close friends died in Nigeria car crash
events.description: British former boxing champion sustained minor injuries Sina Ghami and Kevin ‘Lateef’ Ayodel killed in accident The British heavyweight boxer Anthony Joshua has issued a statement after he was injured in a car crash in Nigeria on Monday morning which killed two of his close friends. The former world heavyweight boxing champion was taken to an undisclosed hospital after his car hit a stationary vehicle at about 11am on the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway, the Ogun state police commissioner, Lanre Ogunlowo, said. The driver of Joshua’s vehicle was also injured, he added. Continue reading...

events.title: Nigeria police detain driver in fatal Joshua car crash
events.description: In tonight's edition, Nigerian police detain the driver of the vehicle involved in the Lagos highway smash in which two people were killed and boxer Anthony Joshua was injured. Also, supporters of Guinea's former junta chief turned president-elect celebrate his win of the weekend's election. And Senegal's leader used his New Year speech to promise that there would be changes in the way that the country tackles violence against women.

events.title: Iran protests turn deadly: Government has offered dialogue in face of demonstrations
events.description: A member of Iran’s security forces was killed, marking the first reported death after several days of demonstrations over soaring inflation, in what has been the most significant unrest in the country since nationwide protests three years ago. Adjunct Senior Lecturer at Lund University, Rouzbeh Parsi, shares his insights.

events.title: UN, US sign $2 billion humanitarian funding agreement for 17 crisis-hit countries
events.description: The United Nations and the United States on Monday formalized an agreement under which the US committed $2 billion in humanitarian assistance for global relief programmes, a move the UN’s top relief official hailed as a landmark commitment to saving lives amid escalating humanitarian needs worldwide.

events.title: Latest updates: Dozens killed and around 100 injured in Switzerland
events.description: The fire broke out around 1.30am local time at a bar at the Crans-Montana ski resort. Multiple people are reported to have died and roughly 100 people injured in the overnight blaze. The Italian Foreign Ministry said that 16 Italian nationals are currently missing and 12 are reported injured.

events.title: Sudan civil war: Health system ‘on the verge of collapse’
events.description: The war in Sudan has been tearing the country apart for almost 1,000 days, putting the country’s health system under intolerable pressure. The World Health Organization (WHO) is reporting widespread disease outbreaks, severe shortages, malnutrition and rising deaths.

events.title: Syria: Guterres deplores deadly mosque blast in Homs
events.description: UN Secretary-General António Guterres “unequivocally condemns” the deadly terrorist attack on a mosque in Homs, Syria during Friday prayers, his spokesperson said in a statement

events.title: Switzerland: New Year catastrophe in Swiss ski resort
events.description: Several dozen people are presumed dead and roughly 100 more injured after a fire ripped through a bar during New Year's Eve celebrations in a luxury resort town in southern Switzerland, police said Thursday. The cause of the fire remains unknown, but Swiss authorities have said the incident is not being treated as an attack of any kind. France24 correspondent John Zarocostas reports.

events.title: Australian police find no evidence of 'broader terrorist cell' in Bondi Beach antisemitic shooting
events.description: Police say an investigation that extended to the Philippines of two men accused of killing 15 people at a Sydney Jewish festival has found no evidence they were part of a “broader terrorist cell.”

events.title: Peruvian municipal officials say three killed in attack on informal mine
events.description: Local officials say the death toll could rise as seven people are missing following the attack on New Year's Eve.

events.title: Switzerland: Dozens killed in fire at Swiss ski resort
events.description: Several dozen people are presumed dead and roughly 100 more injured after a fire ripped through a bar during New Year's Eve celebrations in a luxury resort town in southern Switzerland, police said Thursday. The cause of the fire remains unknown, but Swiss authorities have said the incident is not being treated as an attack of any kind. France24 correspondent John Zarocostas reports the latest.

events.title: Partygoer seen trying to tackle flames in 'horror movie' ski resort fire that killed dozens
events.description: About 40 people were killed and 115 injured in a blaze in at a New Year's Eve Party at an upmarket Swiss ski resort, with the disaster likened to scenes from a horror film.

events.title: Dispatch records from Brown University shooting capture chaos of deadly campus attack
events.description: Newly obtained police records reveal chaotic emergency response to Brown University shooting that left two students dead and multiple wounded on Dec. 13.

events.title: At least 13 people killed and 98 injured in train derailment in Mexico
events.description: Train accident in Oaxaca is likely to raise criticisms about public works projects from the previous administration At least 13 people were killed when a train derailed in the Mexican state of Oaxaca, in an accident which is likely to revive opposition criticisms of the speed and dealings with which the country’s government builds its flagship public works projects. The incident took place on the Interoceanic Train, which was built to link the Atlantic and Pacific oceans across the narrowest part of the Isthmus of Tehuantepec, creating an alternative rail cargo route to the Panama canal intended to drive development in the region. Continue reading...

events.title: Friends and family search for the missing after deadly Swiss fire
events.description: With Swiss police estimating that some 40 people were killed and roughly 115 injured after a fire ravaged a bar in the luxury resort town of Crans-Montana during a New Year's celebration, relatives and friends remain desperate for news of their loved ones.

events.title: WHO research shows COVID vaccines still crucial in preventing severe illness
events.description: Up-to-date vaccination remains the most effective way to prevent severe COVID-19 illness, new research from the World Health Organization (WHO) shows, even as the pandemic has officially ended.

events.title: UN chief urges world leaders to ‘get priorities straight’ as New Year message calls for peace over war
events.description: As the world enters 2026 amid mounting crises, the UN Secretary-General António Guterres has issued a stark but hopeful New Year appeal, urging global leaders to shift resources away from destruction and towards development, peace and people.

events.title: Sri Lanka cyclone: More than a million still need aid weeks after Ditwah floods
events.description: Nearly a month after Cyclone Ditwah tore across Sri Lanka, more than a million people – including over half a million children – remain in urgent need of humanitarian assistance, as floods, landslides and renewed rainfall continue to compound one of the country’s worst disasters in decades.

events.title: Iran in shutdown as protesters storm governor's office, crowds chant 'Death to Khamenei'
events.description: Iran security forces clashed with protesters in Tehran, Shiraz and Kermanshah as opposition groups report gunfire and demonstrators chant "Death to Khamenei" during unrest.

events.title: Several people killed as protests spread across Iran
events.description: A volunteer security official was reportedly also killed during the clashes. As Iran slips deeper into economic crisis, the unrest, which began Sunday in Tehran, has spread to other cities.

events.title: Health advances marked 2025 as wars and funding cuts strained systems
events.description: From eliminating deadly infections to expanding access to lifesaving vaccines, 2025 delivered meaningful progress for global health, according to the UN World Health Organization (WHO), offering cautious optimism at the close of a year marked by both breakthroughs and strain.

events.title: Afghanistan to remain major crisis in 2026, UN, partners warn
events.description: Afghanistan is expected to remain one of the world’s largest humanitarian crises in 2026, UN agencies and humanitarian partners warned on Tuesday, launching a $1.7 billion appeal to assist nearly 18 million people in urgent need.

events.title: Disney World cast member injured after massive boulder prop veers off track at Indiana Jones stunt show
events.description: A Disney World cast member heroically stopped a runaway boulder during an "Indiana Jones" stunt show malfunction that went viral. The dramatic rescue was caught on video.

events.title: Iran protests turn deadly as anti-regime demonstrations enter fifth day
events.description: Anti-regime protests entered a fifth day as demonstrations spread across Tehran and other cities, with reports of deaths emerging amid escalating nationwide unrest.

events.title: At least 17 dead as heavy rains trigger flash floods in Afghanistan
events.description: Dead include five members of a family in the Kabkan district in the province of Herat.

events.title: Greetings from Vienna, where an imperial palace hosts a holiday market for all
events.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

events.title: Pope opens 2026 with plea for peace in countries bloodied by war, families wounded by violence
events.description: Pope Leo XIV has opened 2026 with a plea for peace

events.title: UN peacekeeper injured in gunfire near ‘Blue Line’ in south Lebanon
events.description: One United Nations peacekeeper was injured on Friday after heavy machine gunfire from Israel Defense Forces (IDF) positions south of the Blue Line, following a nearby grenade explosion, impacted close to a UN patrol in southern Lebanon.

events.title: Putin voices confidence in war victory
events.description: Meanwhile, Russia says it will provide Washington with evidence that a Ukrainian drone targeted one of Vladimir Putin’s residences before being shot down on Monday, a claim Ukraine firmly denies. France24 International affairs editor Angela Diffley explains.

events.title: Flash floods triggered by heavy rains in Afghanistan kill at least 17 people
events.description: Afghanistan's disaster management agency says the season’s first heavy rain and snowfall has ended a prolonged dry spell but triggered flash floods, killing at least 17 people and injuring 11 others

events.title: SECURITY COUNCIL LIVE: Briefing on threats to international peace and security
events.description: The UN Security Council meets today to hear a briefing on threats to international peace and security following Israel’s recent recognition of the northern region of Somalia as an independent and sovereign state. Follow live below and UN News app users can click here and go here for all our in-depth meeting coverage.

events.title: Dozens missing after boat carrying 200 migrants sinks off Gambia
events.description: It is the latest accident on one of the world’s most dangerous routes used by West Africans trying to reach Spain.

events.title: Russia says Ukrainian drone strike kills 24 in occupied Ukraine as tensions grow amid peace talks
events.description: Russian officials say that a Ukrainian attack killed 24 people in a Russian-occupied village in Ukraine’s Kherson region, as tensions between the two nations continue to spike despite diplomats hailing productive peace talks

events.title: Young Palestinian boy drowns in muddy water flooding his Gaza tent camp, UN says
events.description: The U.N. said Thursday that a Palestinian boy in Gaza has drowned in floods that engulfed his tent camp and health officials reported the death of a 9 year-old boy in Gaza in unclear circumstances

events.title: Australian among the injured in New Year’s Eve fire that killed 40 at Swiss ski resort
events.description: Australia’s department of foreign affairs providing consular assistance to person injured at Crans-Montana and their family Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast An Australian is among the 115 people injured in a fire that tore through a crowded bar during a New Year’s Eve party in the Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana, killing 40 people. Australia’s climate change and energy minister, Chris Bowen, confirmed on Friday morning that an Australian had been injured and was receiving medical and consular assistance. Continue reading...

events.title: Deaths reported during widening protests in Iran sparked by ailing economy
events.description: The protests began due to economic pressures, with Iran's currency rapidly depreciating. Demonstrators have also chanted against the country's theocracy.

events.title: Switzerland: Dozens killed in bar fire in Alps resort
events.description: At least 40 people died and over 100 others were injured, police say, after a fire tore through a bar during New Year's celebrations. Switzerland's president has said most of the victims were young.

events.title: Everything we know about deadly Swiss ski resort fire
events.description: A fierce blaze that broke out in a Swiss ski resort during New Year's Eve celebrations has killed about 40 people and injured 115, police said on Thursday afternoon.

events.title: UN renews ceasefire push in Sudan
events.description: The UN has urged Sudan’s warring parties to pursue compromise and an immediate ceasefire, even as drone attacks, displacement and the killing of peacekeepers underscore the growing risks to civilians and humanitarians.

events.title: Anti-Iran regime protests grow across country as Trump admin boosts demonstrators offering support
events.description: U.S. officials voice support for Iranian demonstrators as protests intensify following currency crisis, with reports of tear gas and security crackdowns.

events.title: Snorkeller missing in WA as NSW authorities continue search for two lost in rough surf
events.description: Man, 32, had been snorkelling at Ledge Point Beach when reported missing, while police also searching for two who went missing at Coogee Beach and Palm Beach, NSW Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Rescuers are searching for a missing snorkeller off the coast of a small town in Western Australia, as authorities in New South Wales continue to hunt for two people who went missing in hazardous surf over the new year. A 32-year-old man was reported missing while snorkelling at Ledge Point Beach, about 105km north of Perth, at about 3pm on Thursday afternoon, WA police said. Continue reading...

events.title: Several dozen dead after explosion hits Swiss ski resort bar
events.description: Emergency services have been responding overnight after a powerful blast tore through a crowded bar in the Alpine resort of Crans-Montana as New Year celebrations were underway.

events.title: Netanyahu warns of ‘eighth front’ ideological battle for American hearts and minds with Christian leaders
events.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu warns of 'eighth front' in ideological battle, telling Christian leaders that faith must confront terrorism in defense of civilization.

events.title: The 'thorny' issues that threaten to derail a Russia-Ukraine peace deal
events.description: Two of the main sticking points involve territory and the fate of Europe's biggest nuclear plant, which is currently occupied by Russia.

events.title: Ukraine: Attacks disrupt heating as temperatures plunge
events.description: Recent attacks across Ukraine have killed civilians, damaged critical infrastructure and cut heating and power supplies for millions, UN humanitarians report, as temperatures drop below freezing.

events.title: Homeless drifter accused of killing Barnes & Noble Christmas shopper blamed ‘fight or flight’ outburst: report
events.description: Man accused of fatally stabbing woman at Palm Beach Gardens Barnes & Noble allegedly had no prior relationship with victim in random attack, police say.

events.title: Maduro says Venezuela open to US talks on drug trafficking
events.description: In an interview with state TV, the Venezuelan president also evaded a question about an attack in his country claimed by the US.

events.title: Iran starts 2026 facing protests, inflation and sanctions
events.description: At the end of 2025, many Iranian merchants closed their shops to protest rampant inflation. At the start of 2026, the government faces further fallout from sanctions, economic crisis and environmental threats.

events.title: What to know about the deadly NYE fire in a Swiss resort town
events.description: Swiss authorities are investigating the cause of a devastating fire that ripped through a New Year’s celebration at an Alpine ski resort bar, killing about 40 people and injuring more than 115 in what may rank among the deadliest tragedies in the country's recent history. Switzerland will hold five days of national mourning for the victims.

events.title: Pope Leo XIV opens 2026 urging world to reject violence in powerful New Year's Day message
events.description: Pope Leo XIV delivered a message of peace to 40,000 gathered in St. Peter's Square on New Year's Day, calling for disarmed hearts and an end to all forms of violence in 2026.

events.title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian child as Gaza humanitarian crisis deepens
events.description: Israel's continued restrictions on aid deliveries leave Palestinian children particularly vulnerable, aid groups warn.

events.title: Tensions between Saudis and Emiratis over future of Yemen reach boiling point
events.description: Dispute has potential to create civil war in south of Yemen and spill over into neighbouring countries Tensions between the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia over the future of Yemen and the imminent possibility of the declaration of an independent southern state have reached boiling point with Saudi Arabia in effect accusing the UAE of threatening its future security. The dispute has the potential to create a civil war within the south of Yemen and also spill over into other disputes including in Sudan and the Horn of Africa where the two countries often find themselves backing opposite sides. Yemen could yet become only one theatre in which the two vastly wealthy Gulf states vie for political influence, control of shipping lanes and commercial access. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuela open to talks on drug trafficking, says Maduro, but refuses to comment on reported US strike on land
events.description: President Nicolás Maduro reiterated his belief that the US wants to force a change of government in Venezuela and gain access to its vast oil reserves Venezuela is open to negotiating an agreement with the US to combat drug trafficking, the country’s president Nicolás Maduro has said, but he declined to comment on a reported CIA-led strike on a Venezuelan docking area that Donald Trump claimed was used by cartels. Maduro, in the pre-recorded interview with Spanish journalist Ignacio Ramonet, reiterated his belief that the US wants to force a change of government in Venezuela and gain access to its vast oil reserves through its months-long pressure campaign that began with a massive military deployment to the Caribbean Sea in August. Continue reading...

events.title: Iranian protesters attempt to break in to government building as demonstrations escalate
events.description: Iranian protesters attempted to storm a local government building on Wednesday, state media reported, as demonstrations over the cost of living reached their fourth day.

events.title: Sexual violence against children ‘entrenched, systemic and widespread’ across DR Congo, UNICEF warns
events.description: Sexual violence against children has become entrenched, systemic and increasingly widespread across the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), with new data showing a sharp rise in cases since 2022, according to the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF).

events.title: Putin residence attack video slammed; US officials say Ukraine did not target leader
events.description: Defense experts questioned Russia's drone attack claims against President Vladimir Putin's residence after Moscow provides conflicting accounts of intercepted Ukrainian drones.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Usman Khawaja announces retirement from international cricket after SCG Ashes Test
events.description: 39-year-old will bat in fifth Ashes Test in Sydney Australian played 87 Tests, scoring 6,206 runs to date Usman Khawaja has announced his retirement from international cricket, saying the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney will be his last and calling out racism he experienced throughout his career. The batter’s future in Test cricket has been one of the hottest topics of this summer’s Ashes series – he turned 39 last month. Continue reading...

events.title: Israel bans dozens of aid groups from Gaza, despite immense needs
events.description: Dozens of international aid groups, like Doctors Without Borders, are now banned from entering Gaza under new rules set by Israel.

events.title: Several people killed in Iran as cost-of-living protests turn deadly
events.description: The largest protests in Iran in three years reached a deadly climax overnight into Thursday, with several people killed, Iranian media and a rights group have reported.

events.title: Somali daycare in Minnesota broken into, key documents stolen in overnight burglary
events.description: A Somali-run daycare in Minneapolis was allegedly broken into amid ongoing fraud investigations. Important employee and child documents reportedly missing.

events.title: Iran launches satellites on Russian rockets as Moscow-Tehran ties deepen
events.description: Iran launches three satellites with Russian assistance, showcasing deepening cooperation as they resist Western sanctions and international pressure.

events.title: Deadly clashes between protesters and security forces as Iran unrest grows
events.description: Videos on social media showed cars set on fire during running battles as protests entered their fifth day.

events.title: In pictures: New Year welcomed around the world
events.description: From spectacular firework displays to chilly sea dips, nations celebrate the start of 2026.

events.title: What are Russians hoping for in 2026, asks Steve Rosenberg
events.description: The BBC's Russia editor speaks to people in the country as the war in Ukraine nears a fourth year.

events.title: Photos: The world welcomes the new year
events.description: As fireworks light the sky and crowds count down together, communities around the globe welcome 2026.

events.title: Kohberger plea, Cincinnati beating, Read verdict fuel 2025’s most viral, controversial moments
events.description: Viral video of Cincinnati racial beating sparks national outrage as Charlie Kirk's assassination and Shamsud-Din Jabbar's New Orleans attack dominate 2025 headlines.

events.title: 'You're invisible, you don't exist' - life without a birth certificate
events.description: Millions around the world are living in the shadows as stateless people as they lack official papers.

events.title: Saving South Africa's threatened albatross from lethal fishing lines
events.description: A task force is trying to save seabirds from getting caught and killed in fishing boat nets.

events.title: Maduro says Venezuela open to talks with US, remains mum on dock attack
events.description: Venezuela leader strikes conciliatory tone while renewing claim US wants to topple government for vast oil reserves.

events.title: Demonstrations turn deadly in Iran over rising living costs
events.description: At least 6 protesters and a member of the security forces have been killed in demonstrations over living costs in Iran.

events.title: Dozens killed in fire at Swiss Alps bar during New Year's celebration
events.description: Swiss authorities say dozens of people were killed in an overnight fire at the Le Constellation bar at the Crans-Montana ski resort.

events.title: About 40 people are dead and 115 hurt in a fire at Swiss bar's New Year's celebration
events.description: Dozens of people are presumed dead and about 100 injured, most of them seriously, following a fire at a Swiss Alps bar during a New Year's celebration, police said Thursday.

events.title: Swiss bar fire: Officials begin task of identifying victims
events.description: Swiss officials say identifying the burned bodies of those killed in a fire in a bar in Crans-Montana could take days, as families anxiously await news of their loved ones. Follow the latest.

events.title: Anthony Joshua discharged from hospital after Nigeria crash
events.description: The British heavyweight sustained injuries in a car crash that killed two of his friends.

events.title: Anthony Joshua pays respects to friends killed in road crash
events.description: Anthony Joshua has been discharged from hospital days after a car crash in Nigeria that killed two of his close friends.

events.title: Fire at a bar in the Swiss Alps leaves people dead during New Year's celebrations
events.description: A fire at a bar in the Swiss Alps has left people dead and injured during New Year’s celebrations

events.title: A look at some of the worst fires in bars, nightclubs and music venues
events.description: A fire at a bar in the Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana in the early hours of New Year’s Day has left dozens of people presumed dead and around 100 injured, according to authorities

events.title: A fire in an Swiss ski resort bar has left about 40 people dead
events.description: A New Year’s party at a Swiss Alpine bar turned into a tragedy after about 40 people died in a fire and another roughly 115 were injured, mostly seriously

events.title: France reportedly planning to ban children under 15 from social media starting 2026
events.description: France planning social media ban for children under 15, following Australia's lead. Macron pushes new digital restrictions amid youth violence concerns.

events.title: China launches largest military drills off Taiwan in 8 months with live-fire exercises caught on camera
events.description: China launches biggest military encirclement of Taiwan in 8 months with live-fire drills, rockets and warships in massive 'Justice Mission 2025' exercise.

events.title: Peru approves emergency overhaul of state oil firm Petroperu
events.description: The move opens key assets to private investment and comes as Petroperu faces mounting losses and debt.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: France plans social media ban for children under 15: reports
events.description: After Australia's world-first social-media ban for minors, France has drafted a similar law to block under-15s from major platforms, which could take effect from September.

events.title: Another child dies in extreme conditions in Gaza: UNICEF
events.description: A sixth child has died in Gaza this month as the enclave’s people continue to endure dire living conditions linked to freezing rains and the Israel-Hamas war, the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF) has announced. The development comes as aid agencies urged Israeli authorities to reconsider revoking the licences of dozens of humanitarian partners that provide assistance across the devastated enclave from 1 January.

events.title: Unseen Walmart video shows Bryan Kohberger acting differently after Idaho student murders
events.description: New video reveals Bryan Kohberger made 13 Walmart trips during Idaho semester, with suspicious behavior changes after November 2022 student massacre.

events.title: UK PM Starmer–praised Egyptian extremist faces counter-terror probe over resurfaced tweets
events.description: U.K. counterterrorism police assess controversial social media posts by Egyptian-British activist after his return to Britain sparked political backlash.

events.title: How far will the latest protests go in Iran?
events.description: There have been angry protests across the country against economic hardships.

events.title: Why flu cases are surging this season. And, protests erupt in Iran over the economy
events.description: The flu is spreading rapidly across the U.S. this season, and it is expected to get worse. And, protests have erupted across Iran over the country's troubled economy.

events.title: Togo releases Frenchman detained since June over anti-government protests
events.description: A French national detained in Togo last year over his alleged involvement in anti-government protests returned to France on Thursday after his release, the French foreign ministry said. The prosecutor's office in Lome said Steeve Rouyar was one of around 50 protesters arrested on June 6 during a demonstration.

events.title: Pakistan sees deadliest year in a decade, report says
events.description: Pakistan experienced its deadliest year in over a decade in 2025, with combat-related deaths surging 74%, according to a new report from an independent think tank

events.title: Sudan: UN warns of unprecedented child hunger in Darfur as fighting fuels refugee exodus
events.description: Sudan’s deepening war is driving unprecedented levels of hunger, child malnutrition and displacement, UN agencies report, as new data from Darfur and a renewed refugee influx into Chad underscore the rapidly deteriorating situation.

events.title: Gaza battered by heavy rains as humanitarian response continues
events.description: Severe weather conditions have led to further casualties and heightened health risks in Gaza over the past 24 hours, the UN aid coordination office (OCHA) reported on Monday.

events.title: Girl begged for help months before alleged killing by father, girlfriend — earlier abuse case closed: report
events.description: Newly released police records reveal 10-year-old Rebekah Baptiste pleaded for help months before allegedly being killed by her father and girlfriend.

events.title: At least 40 dead in fire at Swiss Alps bar during New Year’s celebrations, police say
events.description: An explosive fire broke out during a New Year’s Eve celebration at a crowded bar in the Swiss Alps, killing around 40 people and injuring others, according to Swiss police.

events.title: China's BYD set to overtake Tesla as world's top EV seller
events.description: It would mark the first time the Chinese firm has outpaced its American rival for annual sales.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be world’s oldest containing adult remains
events.description: 9,500-year-old pyre uncovered in Malawi offers rare insight into rituals of ancient African hunter-gatherer groups A cremation pyre built about 9,500 years ago has been discovered in Africa, offering a fresh glimpse into the complexity of ancient hunter-gatherer communities. Researchers say the pyre, discovered in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi, is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa, and the first pyre to be associated with African hunter-gatherers. Continue reading...

events.title: Ukraine updates: Zelenskyy says Russia fired 200 drones overnight
events.description: Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Russia's strikes show the urgent need for air defense in Ukraine. Meanwhile, the Kremlin blamed Kyiv for a deadly drone strike on a hotel in the occupied Kherson region.

events.title: Taiwan president vows to defend sovereignty after China drills
events.description: President Lai Ching-te said the world is ⁠watching to see ‍whether the Taiwanese people possess the resolve to defend themselves. Meanwhile, Beijing said the eventual annexation of Taiwan is "unstoppable."

events.title: New Year's Eve across the world - in pictures
events.description: All the world's countries have now welcomed in 2026.

events.title: Turkmenistan, one of the world’s most closed nations, legalizes crypto mining and exchanges
events.description: Turkmenistan has officially legalized mining and exchanging cryptocurrency, marking a major shift for its tightly-controlled economy

events.title: Fox News ‘Antisemitism Exposed’ Newsletter: You won't believe what TikTok was selling
events.description: Fox News' "Antisemitism Exposed" newsletter brings you stories on the rising anti-Jewish prejudice across the U.S. and the world.

events.title: China’s ‘condom tax’ sparks backlash as Beijing struggles to reverse population collapse
events.description: China introduced a 13% tax on contraceptives while exempting childcare services as the global superpower battles sustained population decline and aging demographics.

events.title: ISIS exploiting Syria’s chaos as US strikes expose growing threat
events.description: Despite years of defeat claims, ISIS adapts and persists in Syria's chaos, prompting major U.S. military response and raising containment questions.

events.title: Passenger describes 'chaos' after head-on Machu Picchu train collision
events.description: Tourist Niels Honkoop says shattered glass littered the carriage floor and injured people were lying in the aisles.

events.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,408
events.description: These are the key developments from day 1,408 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Amsterdam church destroyed by New Year's blaze
events.description: The beloved 154-year-old Vondel Church in Amsterdam was devastated by a massive fire that erupted shortly after midnight on New Year's Day.

events.title: Germany: Merz says 2026 can be a 'year of new beginnings'
events.description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz touched on war in Ukraine, increased defense spending, changing ties to the US, technological upheaval, industrial stagnation, sluggish reforms, migration and more in his New Year's address.

events.title: Maduro suggests Venezuela is open to talks with US despite military attacks
events.description: Tensions between Caracas and Washington flared this week after US President Donald Trump claimed American forces destroyed a Venezuelan dock used by alleged drug traffickers. President Nicolas Maduro did not confirm, but suggested Venezuela remained willing to engage with the US despite weeks of escalating military pressure in the region.

events.title: EU's new carbon border tax goes into force
events.description: The European Union's controversial new rules on polluting industrial imports went into effect on January 1st, following a two-year transition period. Heavy goods such as steel, aluminium and cement are now subject to a new fee levied according to the amount of CO2 emitted during their production. China issued a statement slamming the measure as unfairly targeting Chinese goods.

events.title: Maduro open to US talks on drug trafficking, but silent on CIA strike
events.description: Venezuela is open to reaching an agreement with the United States to combat drug trafficking, according to President Nicolás Maduro

events.title: San Antonio teen who vanished Christmas Eve found dead by suicide in nearby field after days-long search
events.description: Authorities confirmed missing San Antonio teen Camila Mendoza Olmos, 19, who vanished Christmas Eve, died by suicide after her body was found near her house.

events.title: Ex-police officer given prison time in case prosecuted under Soros DA sees conviction overturned a year later
events.description: A court has overturned the conviction of a former Austin Police Officer Christopher Taylor, acquitting him of all charges in connection to a 2019 shooting.

events.title: Texas sheriff 'strongly' believes remains found belong to missing teen Camila Mendoza Olmos
events.description: Texas sheriff believes remains found in field belong to missing teen Camila Mendoza Olmos, who vanished from hone on Christmas Eve near San Antonio.

events.title: Putin vows victory in Ukraine in New Year’s address amid Trump-backed peace talks
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's defiant New Year's message contrasts sharply with President Donald Trump's diplomatic push as Ukraine-Russia war approaches fourth year.

events.title: Putin residence drone attack dismissed as implausible as Ukraine accusations mount
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's residence allegedly targeted by Ukrainian drones, but drone expert Cameron Chell says the claims lack credibility due to tactical impossibilities.

events.title: Venezuela releases 88 jailed after post-election protests
events.description: The ‍New Year's Day announcement marks the second mass release in a week amid US pressure on President Nicolas ⁠Maduro's government.

events.title: Xi to host South Korea’s Lee in Beijing as China seeks to bolster regional ties
events.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will host South Korean President Lee Jae Myung on a state visit beginning on Sunday, a diplomatic signal of Beijing’s push to deepen ties with Seoul as relations with Japan remain strained over Taiwan and regional security.

events.title: Mamdani vows bold left-wing agenda as he takes office as New York mayor
events.description: Zohran Mamdani pledged to prove that left-wing politics can deliver for ordinary people as he was sworn in as New York City mayor on Thursday, beginning a term likely to bring confrontation with US President Donald Trump and scrutiny of his ambitious plans for the country’s largest city.

events.title: Zohran Mamdani becomes New York City mayor
events.description: Zohran Mamdani became mayor of New York City just after midnight on Thursday, marking a historic moment with a low-key swearing-in ceremony held deep beneath Manhattan. The Democrat, who at 34 is the city’s youngest mayor in generations, takes office as one of the most closely watched political figures in the United States. Ellen Gainsford reports.

events.title: Turkmenistan legalises crypto mining and exchanges in shift for economy
events.description: Legislation signed by President Serdar Berdimuhamedov establishes a licensing scheme overseen by country's central bank.

events.title: US federal employees file complaint against Trump’s anti-transgender policy
events.description: The complaint targets a policy that would nix coverage under federal health insurance for gender-affirming healthcare.

events.title: Somali president blames ISIL and al-Shabab for ‘destroying’ country
events.description: Somalia’s president Hassan Sheikh Mohamud said that ISIL and al-Shabab are responsible fo destroying the country.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Guinea’s junta chief elected president after opposition boycott
events.description: Mamady Doumbouya reneged on promise not to stand and hand west African country back to civilian rule The head of Guinea’s junta, Mamady Doumbouya, who had pledged not to run for office after seizing power four years ago, has been elected president after the country’s electoral commission said he had secured a sweeping majority of the vote. Doumbouya, 41, faced eight rivals for the presidency but the main opposition leaders were barred from running and had urged a boycott of the vote held over the weekend. Continue reading...

events.title: Australian electric car market to get influx of new models as cheaper EVs hit the road in 2026
events.description: New utes, sports cars and hatchbacks will break price records at both ends as traditional brands release electric vehicles in 2026 Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Australians can expect to see more electric utes, sports cars and hatchbacks that break price records at both ends of the spectrum, with changes encouraging even the most reluctant brands to join the trend. But the electric vehicle market could also experience significant regulatory upheaval in 2026, with a road-user charge on the national agenda and a review of tax exemptions. Continue reading...

events.title: Italy makes tiny tweak to its anthem, deleting just one word
events.description: Italy has quietly made a small change to its national anthem, removing a single word.

events.title: What to know about 2026 European Capitals of Culture
events.description: This year, Oulu, Finland, and Trencin, Slovakia, will become Europe's cultural flagships. Learn more about how Europe's Capitals of Culture program brings lasting change to cities.

events.title: Top Paris exhibits of 2026 – from Matisse and Renoir to Martin Parr
events.description: The coming year brings a host of new exhibitions to the French capital, including blockbuster shows from modern masters Matisse and Renoir, to photographer Martin Parr’s witty observations on environmental destruction, and an exploration of the history of video game music.

events.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro leaves hospital and returns to jail in capital Brasilia
events.description: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro left a hospital in capital Brasilia on Thursday, a week after he underwent a double hernia surgery

events.title: What's inside Mexico's Popocatépetl volcano? Scientists obtain first 3D images
events.description: Scientists from Mexico’s National Autonomous University have created the first three-dimensional image of the Popocatépetl volcano's interior

events.title: Venezuela arrests more Americans as Trump ramps up pressure on Maduro: report
events.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio confirmed 10 Americans were freed from Venezuela in a July prisoner swap. President Donald Trump sent an envoy to Caracas.

events.title: What we know about the Switzerland ski resort fire
events.description: Several dozen people are presumed to have died in the fire at a New Year party in the resort of Crans-Montana.

events.title: Venezuela releases more prisoners amid US pressure campaign: Rights groups
events.description: Second release of prisoners related to 2024 election protests seen as possible conciliatory move from Maduro.

events.title: US ‘adapt, shrink or die’ terms for $2bn aid pot will mean UN bowing down to Washington, say experts
events.description: Afghanistan and Yemen excluded from list of 17 priority countries chosen by Trump administration to receive aid laden with demands The $2bn (£1.5bn) of aid the US pledged this week may have been hailed as “bold and ambitious” by the UN but could be the “nail in the coffin” in changing to a shrunken, less flexible aid system dominated by Washington’s political priorities, aid experts fear. After a year of deep cuts in aid budgets by the US and European countries, the announcement of new money for the humanitarian system is a source of some relief, but experts are deeply concerned about demands that the US has imposed on how the money should be managed and where it can go. Continue reading...

events.title: US struck ‘big facility’ in Venezuela, Trump claimed without offering details
events.description: Trump alleged that US forces hit ‘very hard’ in what would mark his team’s first land strike on Venezuela if confirmed Donald Trump has claimed that US forces struck a “big facility” in Venezuela last week – but the president did not specify what it was, or where, and the White House has not commented further. “We just knocked out – I don’t know if you read or you saw – they have a big plant, or a big facility, where the ships come from. Two nights ago, we knocked that out. So we hit them very hard,” Trump told Republican donor and New York supermarket owner John Catsimatidis on Friday. Continue reading...

events.title: Taiwan's president pledges to defend island's sovereignty after Chinese military drills
events.description: Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te vowed to defend the self-ruled island's sovereignty in the face of what he termed China's "expansionist ambitions," days after Beijing wrapped up live-fire military drills near its shores.

events.title: France proposes social media ban, following the Australian model for under-15s
events.description: For several years, the French government has explored ways to limit teenagers’ access to social media due to its harmful impact on mental health, and new guidance from the European Commission could now make it easier for France to pass legislation on the matter. A bill proposing a ban on social media for children under 15 has already been introduced and is expected to be debated early this year, with F24’s Solange Mougin reporting on how families feel about the proposal.

events.title: Witness saw people 'walking on top of others' as they tried to escape fire in packed bar
events.description: A man who witnessed a bar fire in Switzerland has told Sky News he saw patrons walking over people as they tried to escape the packed venue.

events.title: Dead birds on Florida beaches have experts worried about avian flu
events.description: Dead birds along Florida's Space Coast spark fears of a possible avian flu outbreak. Samples were sent for testing as wildlife officials monitor the situation.

events.title: South Korean President Lee to visit Beijing for pivotal 2nd summit with Xi
events.description: Analysts say summit signals Beijing's desire to strengthen ties amid shifting regional alliances.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Kim Jong-un’s daughter visits state mausoleum, fuelling speculation she will be next North Korean ruler
events.description: Kim Ju-ae has been making increasingly prominent appearances in state media over the past three years The daughter of the North Korean ruler, Kim Jong-un, who is likely being prepared as his successor has accompanied her parents on her first public visit to the Kumsusan mausoleum to pay respects to former leaders, ahead of an event that could see her succession formalised. Photos from state news agency KCNA showed Kim Jong-un accompanied by his wife, Ri Sol-ju, and senior officials on the visit on 1 January, with Ju-ae between her parents in the main hall of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun. Continue reading...

events.title: NewJeans member Danielle sued for millions after bitter feud with K-pop record label
events.description: Ador terminated the Australian-born singer’s contract on Monday and is now suing her, a family member and the band’s former producer The K-pop record label Ador is suing a former member of megaband NewJeans for millions in damages, it has announced, a day after removing her from the group following a year-long dispute that saw the band allege mistreatment and attempt to leave their contract. The compensation suit against Danielle Marsh, a 20-year-old Australian-born singer, comes months after a Seoul district court ruled that NewJeans’ five members must honour their contracts with Ador, whose parent company Hybe is also behind the K-pop sensation BTS. The band’s contract runs until 2029. Continue reading...

events.title: Former U.S. ambassador to China discusses the relationship between the two countries
events.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks to Nicholas Burns, former U.S. ambassador to China, about the current state of relations between the U.S. and China.

events.title: Yemen: Separatists to allow Saudi-backed forces into seized areas
events.description: A UAE-backed group pushing for independence in southern Yemen has agreed to the deployment of Saudi-aligned forces in the oil-rich territory it seized last month.

events.title: Conscription, pensions and AfD on Germany's 2026 agenda
events.description: Pensions, migration and conscription will continue to dominate domestic politics in Germany this year. Above all, the focus will be on how the far-right AfD fares in upcoming state elections in the former East Germany.

events.title: US health insurance costs to rise by 114% for millions as subsidies expire
events.description: More than 20 million people in the United States will face sharply higher health insurance costs as of January 1 after enhanced tax credits that helped enrollees in the Affordable Care Act afford coverage expired overnight. The expiration of the subsidies will mostly affect families, small business owners and self-employed workers.

events.title: Results expected 5 January after landmark elections in Central African Republic
events.description: Voting proceeded largely as planned in the Central African Republic’s first-ever combined presidential, legislative, regional and municipal elections, and ballot counting is now complete, the UN peacekeeping mission (MINUSCA) said on Wednesday, with results expected to be announced on 5 January.

events.title: Trump says health is 'perfect' amid ageing concerns
events.description: In an interview about his health, Trump talked about using hand makeup, getting by on little sleep and taking lots of aspirin.

events.title: Handshake in Dhaka: Can India and Pakistan revive ties in 2026?
events.description: An unexpected handshake in Dhaka has prompted debate on whether India and Pakistan might restart talks in 2026.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Access to RSS feeds is rejected
events.description: Your large amount of concurrent requests for RSS data causes problems. Use the API or contact ops@reliefweb.int

events.title: Kim Jong Un appears with daughter at mausoleum, fueling succession speculation
events.description: Kim Jong Un's daughter, Ju Ae, appeared at a sacred mausoleum, fueling speculation about North Korea's succession plan as analysts debate her role.

events.title: University of Alabama student suffers 'severe head injury' while on family vacation in Caribbean
events.description: University of Alabama student Matthew Polaski reportedly suffered multiple skull fractures after falling during a family vacation in the Dominican Republic.

events.title: Two African nations ban American citizens in diplomatic tit-for-tat following Trump admin move
events.description: Two West African nations issue travel bans on American citizens in retaliatory diplomatic move, following expansion of Trump administration travel restrictions list.

events.title: Eurostar to resume services to and from London after 'major disruption' in Channel Tunnel forced cancellations
events.description: Eurostar suspends all London services due to major power supply issues in Channel Tunnel and failed LeShuttle train, forcing passengers to rebook journeys.

events.title: New discovery may challenge theory Vikings built first Irish towns - researcher
events.description: Dr Dirk Brandherm and his colleagues have identified more than 600 suspected house platforms in the Brusselstown Ring.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: UK says small boat migrant arrivals approached record levels in 2025
events.description: The number of migrants reaching the UK in small boats in 2025 climbed to its second-highest level since records began, official figures showed on Thursday, piling pressure on Prime Minister Keir Starmer as anti-immigration sentiments gain ground ahead of key local elections in May.

events.title: New York's new mayor 'won't hesitate' to use his power
events.description: New York's new mayor Zohran Mamdani has vowed to run the city "expansively and audaciously" after his historic inauguration.

events.title: The road ahead for transit in New York City in 2026 includes fare hikes
events.description: New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani campaigned on making buses in the Big Apple "fast and free," but the MTA oversees the bus system, and there will soon be a small fare hike.

events.title: Japan PM joins fight for more female toilets in parliament
events.description: Japan's parliament building was built in 1936, a decade before women were given the right to vote.

events.title: Stranger Things draws to an epic and emotional close
events.description: Fans gathered at premieres in cities across the US and Canada to watch the finale on the big screen.

events.title: Zelensky says peace deal is 90% ready in New Year address
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin used his New Year speech to tell troops that he "believed in you and our victory" in Ukraine.

events.title: Brazil legend Roberto Carlos recovering in hospital
events.description: Brazil and Real Madrid legend Roberto Carlos is "recovering well" after undergoing what he describes as "a preventative medical procedure".

events.title: Social media fuelled Mamdani's rise. Can he keep the momentum as New York mayor?
events.description: To succeed in office he will need to keep his supporters engaged with day-to-day governing, experts say.

events.title: Americans brace to start New Year without healthcare
events.description: More than 20 million Americans are preparing for steeper healthcare costs in the New Year because of expiring subsidies.

events.title: Watch: Moment 400-pound runaway prop injures Disney employee
events.description: The incident took place during a live recreation of a scene from the film of Indiana Jones

events.title: Gaza cousins face lost youth, and family tragedy, after amputations
events.description: Despite losing limbs and loved ones, Gaza's Abdullah and Diaa hold onto hope for prosthetic limbs and a better future.

events.title: South African activist uses history to highlight ongoing injustice
events.description: An activist-turned-historian takes tourists through South Africa's painful colonial history, which still echoes today.

events.title: Flights from Aden airport in Yemen halted amid latest tensions
events.description: STC separatists accuse Saudi Arabia of requiring flights to UAE to land in Jeddah; Saudi source rejects claim.

events.title: Kim Jong Un’s potential heir makes public visit to N Korean founder’s tomb
events.description: Kim Ju Ae's first public visit to the Kumsusan Mausoleum added to speculation she may become the next in line.

events.title: ‘We will not wait’: Mamdani kicks off housing plans after inaugural party
events.description: The inaugural ceremony broke with tradition, as large crowds and a public party greeted New York's new mayor.

events.title: US says Chinese military drills around Taiwan cause unnecessary tensions
events.description: US recently approved $11bn arms package for Taiwan, which condemned 'provocative' Chinese military drills.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Jair Bolsonaro undergoes second procedure to treat persistent hiccups
events.description: Former Brazilian president underwent a phrenic nerve block while temporarily released from prison for surgery Jair Bolsonaro underwent a second “phrenic nerve block procedure” on Monday to treat persistent hiccups. The treatment went well and the former Brazilian president’s condition is stable, according to his medical team. Continue reading...

events.title: Xi Jinping vows to reunify China and Taiwan in New Year’s Eve speech
events.description: Reunification ‘is unstoppable’, says Chinese president, a day after the conclusion of intense military drills China’s president, Xi Jinping, has vowed to reunify China and Taiwan in his annual New Year’s Eve speech in Beijing. Speaking the day after the conclusion of intense Chinese military drills around Taiwan, Xi said: “The reunification of our motherland, a trend of the times, is unstoppable.” Continue reading...

events.title: China forecast to have sold one in every 10 new cars in UK in 2025
events.description: Carmakers such as MG, BYD and Chery are set to pass 200,000 mark in sales, analysis suggests, double 2024’s total Chinese brands are on course to account for one in every 10 new cars sold in Britain during 2025, a marked increase on last year as sales increase across Europe. Manufacturers led by MG, BYD, and Chery are on track to break the 200,000 mark in UK new car sales in 2025, meaning they are very likely to account for 10% of the market, according to Matthias Schmidt, an analyst tracking electric cars across Europe. Continue reading...

events.title: ​Two cubicles, 73 women, one long queue: Japan’s female MPs fight for more loos
events.description: PM Sanae Takaichi joins petition asking for better facilities for women to match improved representation Nearly 60 female lawmakers in Japan, including the prime minister, Sanae Takaichi, have submitted a petition calling for more toilets in the parliament building for women to match their improved representation. Japanese politics remains hugely male-dominated, although the number of women in the parliament rose at the last election – and Takaichi became the first female prime minister in October. This is reflected by there being only one lavatory containing two cubicles for the lower house’s 73 women to use near the Diet’s main plenary session hall in central Tokyo. Continue reading...

events.title: Why plastic bans aren't working and what needs to change
events.description: Four years after Germany phased out light plastic bags, how has the EU addressed plastic waste — and why do single-use items still pile up in takeaway restaurants, shops and the environment?

events.title: Germany news: Large fall in illegal border entries recorded
events.description: The number of illegal border entries in Germany has decreased by over 50% in the past two years, according to police data. DW has more.

events.title: South Korea's Lee ditches hard-line path on Kim, North Korea
events.description: With ties between the Koreas at rock bottom, South Korea's Lee Jae Myung is advancing several initiatives aimed to build bridges with the Kim Jong Un regime — including one focusing on the martial art of taekwondo.

events.title: Bulgaria joins Eurozone despite opposition
events.description: Bulgaria became the 21st member of the currency union, bringing the number of people using the single European currency to more than 350 million.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Kyiv says it struck Russia's oil facilities
events.description: According to officials in Kyiv, Ukrainian long-range drones struck an oil depot north of Moscow, as well as an oil refinery and an oil terminal in Russia's southern Krasnodar region.

events.title: Bolsonaro leaves hospital and returns to prison after being denied house arrest
events.description: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro has been discharged from hospital in Brasília and taken back into custody, a week after undergoing double hernia surgery, as he continues to serve a prison sentence for leading an attempted coup.

events.title: 'Stranger things' ends after 10 years
events.description: Netflix has released the final episode of one of its biggest original hits, with the season five finale of Stranger Things going live on the platform at 1 a.m. GMT; the 1980s-set sci-fi adventure series has captured the cultural zeitgeist and become Netflix’s longest-running cash cow, as Carys Garland explores.

events.title: Millions are being 'slowly poisoned' - and pleas for change are being ignored
events.description: "The air is absolutely poison, in the last two years we've not had even one single good a day in spite of the monsoon rain," says Bhavreen Kandhari, an activist spearheading a public movement on clean air.

events.title: Finland police seize vessel suspected of damaging Baltic Sea cable
events.description: Finnish police have seized a cargo vessel suspected of damaging an undersea cable.

events.title: Australia's Northern Territory considers passing assisted dying laws for second time in 31 years
events.description: The Northern Territory government in Australia plans to legislate for doctor-assisted dying for a second time

events.title: Taiwan’s president pledges to defend sovereignty after China’s military drills
events.description: Taiwan’s president pledges to defend sovereignty after China’s military drills

events.title: Kim’s daughter visits family mausoleum, promoting her potential status as heir in North Korea
events.description: The teenage daughter of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has made her first known visit to a sacred family mausoleum where the embalmed bodies of her late grandfather and great-grandfather are on display

events.title: A Kenyan barber who wields a sharpened shovel thrives on Africa's social media craze
events.description: Safari Martins may be Kenya’s most famous barber

events.title: Bulgaria is joining the euro. Here's what it means for consumers and businesses
events.description: Bulgaria is welcoming a new year and a new currency

events.title: Khaleda Zia, former Bangladeshi prime minister and archrival of a previous premier, dies at 80
events.description: Former Bangladeshi Prime Minister Khaleda Zia has died at 80, her political party has announced Tuesday

events.title: China announces it 'successfully completed' Taiwan military maneuvers
events.description: China’s People’s Liberation Army says it has “successfully completed” two days of military exercises in the waters off Taiwan

events.title: UN chief condemns Israeli amendments targeting UNRWA operations
events.description: The UN Secretary-General has condemned amendments adopted by Israel’s Knesset to a law aimed at ceasing the operations of the UN agency assisting Palestine refugees (UNRWA), saying the measures must be immediately repealed.

events.title: General Assembly approves $3.45 billion UN regular budget for 2026
events.description: The General Assembly has approved a $3.45 billion regular budget for the United Nations for 2026, following weeks of intensive negotiations and one of the Organization’s most important reform initiatives, UN80.

events.title: LIVE: General Assembly decides on 2026 UN budget
events.description: Follow our live coverage as the General Assembly and its Fifth Committee meet today to finalize negotiations and vote on the United Nations’ regular budget for 2026. The Fifth Committee is responsible for administrative and budgetary matters, including the Organization’s finances and staffing. UN News app users can click here and go here for all our in-depth meeting coverage.

events.title: 5 big immigration changes taking effect across the US
events.description: Major U.S. immigration policy changes in 2025 include Trump administration H-1B visa overhaul, expanded facial recognition and social media scrutiny.

events.title: Repeat offender truck driver charged with bank robbery after claiming C-4 explosives, firing on officers: feds
events.description: North Carolina truck driver allegedly robs bank claiming explosives, then engages in shootout with police after fleeing the scene in his semi-truck.

events.title: Mangione, Robinson, Reiner and more: Major court cases set to dominate 2026
events.description: Court calendars packed with major criminal cases as accused murderers, including Luigi Mangione and Rex Heuermann, await their upcoming trial dates in 2026.

events.title: Deported illegal immigrant caught by GPS tracker pleads guilty to robbing 7 convenience stores in California
events.description: Previously deported man from El Salvador pleads guilty to armed robberies across eight California cities, facing up to 20 years per count in prison.

events.title: Texas woman tries to flee to Mexico across Rio Grande with infant after human smuggling bust, authorities say
events.description: A Texas woman accused of human smuggling allegedly tried to flee across Rio Grande with infant after high-speed chase near the Mexico border.
